name: TypeScript Basics
description: Core TypeScript concepts and type system fundamentals

questions.question: What is TypeScript?
questions.answer: A statically typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript

questions.question: What are the primitive types in TypeScript?
questions.answer: string, number, boolean, null, undefined, symbol, bigint, any, unknown, never, void

questions.question: What is the difference between 'any' and 'unknown' types?
questions.answer: 'any' disables type checking entirely, while 'unknown' requires type checking before use. Unknown is safer.

questions.question: What is an interface in TypeScript?
questions.answer: A way to define the structure of an object, specifying property names and types

questions.question: What is the difference between interface and type?
questions.answer: Interfaces can be extended and merged, types can use unions/intersections. Both define object shapes.

questions.question: What are generics in TypeScript?
questions.answer: A way to create reusable components that work with multiple types while maintaining type safety

questions.question: What is a tuple in TypeScript?
questions.answer: An array with fixed length and specific types for each position

questions.question: What does the 'readonly' modifier do?
questions.answer: Makes properties or array elements immutable, preventing modification after initialization
